Description: Sheet iron lamp, the top and bottom made separately and joined. The underside has a bowl-body and long rounded nozzle with a rounded tip. Raised oval base, concave below. The top is domed over the body, with a narrow serrated rim extending along the level nozzle-top, which has volutes and a blunt, multi-angled tip. The dome and the volutes are outlined with rows of impressed points. Circular wick-hole. The centre of the dome is depressed and contains a quincunx of five small filling-holes; this filling-hole area is slightly damaged. Surface colouration: brown iron corrosion-products.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Monastery of St Phoibammon, from the site of the temple of Mentuhotep
Curator's comments: Close, also of iron: Hayes, J.W., 1984. ‘Greek, Roman, and related metalware in the Royal Ontario Museum’. Toronto : Royal Ontario Museum, No. 248 from the Fayum.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (3799)
Godlewski 1986 / Le monastère de St Phoibammon (p.120, no. 27, fig.96)
